session
Interface SessionsHandler

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
GlobusSessionsHandler, RMISessionsHandler
public interface SessionsHandler
extends java.rmi.Remote

Communications between certified sessions. To invoke methods of this interface, a simulation session must logon itself, and sign all of its method invocations. This interface provides methods for creating remote instances of Datatype objects. In particular, an implementation of this interface should be used by a RemoteInstantiator implementation in order to allow that instantiator to ask for the creation of a new instance of a given model implementation.

When a datatype implementation is instantiated by an object implementing this interface, then a stub and an invoker class files for remote Datatype objects from the names of compiled Java classes are generated.

All of its remote methods throw the RemoteException for compatibility with Java's RMI framework.

Author:
Ricardo Corrï¿½a (correa@lia.ufc.br)

                      java.lang.String sessionName)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Logon a specified session with its name. It starts the corresponding session driver.

Parameters:
sdriverClassName - the name of the session driver class to be instantiated
sessionName - the name of this session
Returns:
true if the session has been properly logged on.

secureLogOn

boolean secureLogOn(java.lang.String sdriverClassName,
                    java.security.cert.Certificate sessionCert)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Logon a specified session with its public key. It starts the corresponding session driver.

Parameters:
sdriverClassName - the name of the session driver class to be instantiated
sessionCert - the session identification. The owner is user@host, and the issuer is SessionGUI.
Returns:
true if the session has been properly logged on.

sessionsHandlerOf

SessionsHandler sessionsHandlerOf(java.lang.String locationName)
                                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns the remote signable session handler associated with a specified location. The SignableSessionHandler returned by this method determines the implementation of the Remote Interaction Level will be used. A concrete implementation of this class must implement this method.

Parameters:
locationName - the location name
Returns:
the session, if one is found, or null otherwise.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - TODO
